SEARCH
Package com.paiva.investments.controller

Class AssetController

java.lang.Object
com.paiva.investments.controller.AssetController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/api/assets") public class AssetController extends Object
REST controller for managing assets. Provides endpoints for asset-related operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Controller responsible for handling requests related to assets.

      Returns:
      HTTP 200 (OK) with the list of all assets

      Retrieves an asset by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the asset
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 (OK) with the asset entity

    • createAsset

      Creates a new asset.
      Parameters:
      asset - the asset to be created
      Returns:
      HTTP 201 (Created) with the created asset

    • createRealStateFund

      @PostMapping("/realstatefunds") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Asset> createRealStateFund(@RequestBody RealStateFund fund)
      Creates a new Real State Fund asset.
      Parameters:
      fund - the real state fund to be created
      Returns:
      HTTP 201 (Created) with the created real state fund asset

    • createStock

      @PostMapping("/stocks") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Asset> createStock(@RequestBody Stock stock)
      Creates a new stock asset.
      Parameters:
      stock - the stock to be created
      Returns:
      HTTP 201 (Created) with the created stock asset

    • updateAsset

      @PutMapping("/update/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Asset> updateAsset(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Asset updatedAsset)
      Updates an existing asset.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the asset to update
      updatedAsset - the updated asset data
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 (OK) with the updated asset

    • deleteById

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteById(@PathVariable Long id)
      Deletes an asset by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the asset to delete
      Returns:
      HTTP 204 (No Content) if deletion was successful
